EC2.description: Elastic compute service that provides resizable compute capacity in the cloud
EC2.certification_notes: Know instance types (t2, m5, c5, etc.), pricing models (on-demand, reserved, spot), and auto scaling capabilities. Understand placement groups and instance store vs EBS.

S3.description: Object storage service that offers industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance
S3.certification_notes: Understand storage classes (Standard, IA, Glacier), lifecycle policies, versioning, and bucket policies. Know about encryption options and cross-region replication.

LAMBDA.description: Serverless compute service that lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers
LAMBDA.certification_notes: Focus on triggers, execution context, timeout limits (15 min max), and integration with other services. Know about layers and environment variables.

DYNAMODB.description: Fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability
DYNAMODB.certification_notes: Know about partition keys, sort keys, and read/write capacity units. Understand DAX, Global Tables, and the difference between eventually consistent and strongly consistent reads.

RDS.description: Managed relational database service that makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale a relational database
RDS.certification_notes: Understand multi-AZ deployments, read replicas, and backup options. Know supported database engines and their features.

SNS.description: Fully managed messaging service for both application-to-application and application-to-person communication
SNS.certification_notes: Know about topics, subscriptions, and supported notification types (SMS, email, HTTP, SQS). Understand fan-out pattern with SNS and SQS.

SQS.description: Fully managed message queuing service that enables you to decouple and scale microservices
SQS.certification_notes: Understand standard vs FIFO queues, visibility timeout, dead-letter queues, and long polling vs short polling.

CLOUDFRONT.description: Content delivery network service that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs globally
CLOUDFRONT.certification_notes: Know about distributions, origins, behaviors, and cache invalidation. Understand edge locations vs regional edge caches.

IAM.description: Web service that helps you securely control access to AWS resources
IAM.certification_notes: Understand users, groups, roles, and policies. Know the difference between identity-based and resource-based policies. Understand the principle of least privilege.

CLOUDWATCH.description: Monitoring and observability service that provides data and insights to monitor applications
CLOUDWATCH.certification_notes: Know about metrics, alarms, logs, and events. Understand the difference between basic and detailed monitoring.

ROUTE53.description: Highly available and scalable cloud Domain Name System web service
ROUTE53.certification_notes: Understand routing policies (simple, weighted, latency-based, failover, geolocation). Know about health checks and DNS record types.

GLACIER.description: Secure, durable, and extremely low-cost Amazon S3 storage class for data archiving and long-term backup
GLACIER.certification_notes: Know retrieval options (expedited, standard, bulk) and their costs. Understand Vault Lock policies and lifecycle rules.

VPC.description: Virtual network dedicated to your AWS account that is logically isolated from other virtual networks in the AWS Cloud
VPC.certification_notes: Understand subnets, route tables, internet gateways, NAT gateways, security groups, and NACLs. Know VPC peering, VPC endpoints, and Transit Gateway.

ECS.description: Highly scalable, fast container management service that makes it easy to run, stop, and manage containers
ECS.certification_notes: Know about task definitions, services, clusters, and launch types (EC2 vs Fargate). Understand service auto scaling and task placement strategies.

CLOUDFORMATION.description: Service that gives developers and businesses an easy way to create a collection of related AWS resources
CLOUDFORMATION.certification_notes: Understand templates, stacks, and stack sets. Know about intrinsic functions, pseudo parameters, and drift detection.

ATHENA.description: Interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL
ATHENA.certification_notes: Know that it's serverless and priced per query. Understand integration with Glue Data Catalog and supported file formats.

KINESIS.description: Platform for streaming data on AWS, offering powerful services to make it easy to load and analyze streaming data
KINESIS.certification_notes: Know the difference between Kinesis Data Streams, Firehose, Analytics, and Video Streams. Understand shards, producers, and consumers.

ELASTICBEANSTALK.description: Easy-to-use service for deploying and scaling web applications and services
ELASTICBEANSTALK.certification_notes: Understand environments, application versions, and configuration. Know supported platforms and deployment options.

COGNITO.description: User identity and data synchronization service that helps you securely manage and synchronize app data
COGNITO.certification_notes: Know the difference between User Pools and Identity Pools. Understand authentication flow and integration with social identity providers.

APIGATEWAY.description: Fully managed service that makes it easy for developers to create, publish, maintain, monitor, and secure APIs
APIGATEWAY.certification_notes: Understand REST APIs vs HTTP APIs vs WebSocket APIs. Know about stages, deployments, and API keys. Understand throttling and caching.
